title: Reasons why you may need to go for couples therapy
text:
Next Story : Indulge in luxurious oils with Lakme Salon

Let's face it, not many of us are too comfortable with the idea of seeing a couples therapist or a relationship counsellor. Most tend to think that ups and downs in a relationship are part and parcel of life and every couple should be capable of handling relationship setbacks on their own, without the intervention of a third party. While that may be true, the fact of the matter is that when disagreements reach an impasse, you may need to start thinking of therapy, in order to make a last ditch effort to save your relationship. In fact, without waiting for things to come to such a pass, start therapy early when you feel that something is amiss in your marriage or relationship. After all, as the cliche goes, a stitch in time saves nine. So, the question is, how do you know that your and your partner need couples therapy?Not a single day goes without you and your partner fighting over supremely petty issues. You start feeling that you and your SO are never on the same page really. And that is creating quite a chaos in your life and in the lives of those who depend on you.There can't perhaps be anything worse than communication breakdown in a relationship. If you can't talk things out or if you feel that you and your SO hardly have anything to say to each other, it's time to look for an alternative communication channel - in other words, seek a couples therapist.Say one of you has committed adultery - it could be a full-fledged sexual liaison or an emotional affair. In this case, there's a breach of trust. So, what's broken needs to be mended, or not. Talk to a couples therapist to see if you and partner can survive such a catastrophic event in your relationship.
description: Couples therapy can come in handy if disagreements reach an impasse in your relationship. Here are some other reasons for seeking a counsellor.
